intro: Distimake somalensis, commonly known as the Somali distimake, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the early morning. Its fruit is a elongated, slender capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
